WRITING.TITLE: How long is this surgery? (avr+root)
WRITING.TEXT: My dad is in Aortic valve replacement and root surgery at the moment. They made their first incision at about 10:30, it is now 2:20 and they said the valve and graft are installed and they are just warming up the body and heart. After that they will take him off the heart lung machine and start beating his heart. Then closure. How long?!

WRITING.TITLE: Can I raise my GPA to 3.5?

WRITING.TITLE: wtf?
Can I move all my PC parts to another computer?
WRITING.TEXT: I am sorry I put this in AskReddit. I didn't know what subreddit to ask this in so I figured I'd just throw it in here. Anyways, I have an Acer Aspire X3950 and the tower is very small... I had to unscrew some of the casing off my video card just to get it in there (did not take out anything important) Here is a picture with the same size of my tower (shows how small it is): http://www.villman.com/product_photos/acer-x3950.gif (gif? idk why) Basically its half the height of a regular tower and half the width also. It's length is normal. Is there any way I can very safely move all of these parts into a bigger tower so that I can upgrade it? I am pretty sure the motherboard is regular sized. EDIT: I am done looking at this post cuz my question has been answered :D thanks

WRITING.TITLE: Bought a CSGO server last night
WRITING.TEXT: Last night I bought a CSGO server because I had a lifetime 50% off of the monthly fee... I just added all the highest settings (Payed an extra 20 bucks for all of them) Such as 128 tick..."ultra accel"...high CPU I would appreciate it if people played in it just so I can say I am putting it to use rather than have it sitting around like many other gameservers. 66.225.195.204:27015 -- Chicago, IL (US Central) If you guys have any feedback/suggestions just reply here. There are so many differences compared to running a 1.6 server which I could still use help on. OH and we could use some more admins... assuming people will actually play here. edit: Thanks for all the support everyone! Server was pretty packed earlier and I am happy that you all came to play :) Took everyones advice too

WRITING.TITLE: I want to sell a PC I built
WRITING.TEXT: So I built my PC 2 months ago but I would really like to sell it because I now need a laptop. How can I go about selling? Is ebay okay? Can somebody explain to me the entire process of selling my computer on ebay? How much can I sell it for? Specs: Case: Rosewill Challenger Mobo: gigabyte z77x ud3h Cpu: i5 3570k 3.4ghz (OC to stable 4.1 ghz) Gpu: sapphire 7850 hd (OC edition + additional stable OC) PSU: corsair builder cx500 Ram: 8gb 1866 gskill area HDD: 1tb 7200 rpm WD SSD: 64gb crucial m4 Sound Card: asus xonar dg Cost me about 700 to make Also have a 24' asus Vh232h monitor I can sell (which cost me 130 dollars) Everything is dustless and looks brand new still (i clean it every weekend)

WRITING.TITLE: Can somebody tell me about the ebay selling fees?
WRITING.TEXT: I want to sell a PC that i built. its in brand new condition. no dust or anything (cleaned weekly)

WRITING.TITLE: Best Laptop for this Form
WRITING.TEXT: **LAPTOP QUESTIONNAIRE** * Country of purchase: USA * Budget range: 1-700 * Purpose (netbook, ultraportable, mainstream, gaming, desktop replacement, etc.): mainstream/portable * Screen size preference: 14' and below is best * OS preference (Windows/ Mac/ Linux): windows * Gaming requirements (example games and desired fps/settings): integrated is fine (intel hd 4000) * Performance requirements (video, CAD, etc.): I need a powerful processor (i7 3rd gen) dual or quad * Method of computer support (office supplier, college bookstore, self support): School/Light gaming that integrated is fine with * Brand preferences and reasons (already owned accessories, familiarity, business compatibility): Aluminum casing for sure. * Any particular style that you like (examples are great): Aluminum Casing. * Which of the following qualities would you prefer? (Choose one, the other, or balanced) * Long battery life -vs- Low weight: Balanced * Build quality -vs- Low price: Balanced * Low noise/heat -vs- High performance: I dont want something thats gonna overheat really easily **Would you pay a premium for something that has:** * High resolution screen: maybe * A great keyboard: nope * A great touchpad/mouse buttons: nope * Great audio: nope **List any features that are critical:** (e.g. Optical drive, USB 3.0, SD card slot, ethernet port, HDMI port, bluetooth, VGA port, removable battery, glossy screen, matte screen, etc.) HDMI, Aluminum Casing, Good to carry around

WRITING.TITLE: [Troubleshooting] Xonar DG sound card reverb/echo
WRITING.TEXT: I built my computer about a month ago and I added a Xonar DG sound card. It is now reverbing/echoing all of a sudden an hour ago after I alt tabbed out of CSGO. Anyone know how to fix it? i tried restarting/disabling computer, etc... if the volume is really low i cant really hear the problem though. But once I raise it the reverb starts and then once i raise it to a certain level all the bars on the equalizer thing shoot up (30, 60, 120....16k) and it creates a loud scary noise. EDIT: FIGURED IT OUT! STEREO MIX ENABLED SOMEHOW!!! anyone know whats up??

WRITING.TITLE: Which Linux version should I use for this computer?
WRITING.TEXT: I am completely new to Linux. Which version should I use? I tried Linux Mint 8 (Helena Fluxbot) but I don't know how to connect to the internet on it... Specs: Dell Inspiron Laptop Intel Core Solo 1.66ghz 512mb RAM 60gb HD Thanks!!! edit: about to try Lubuntu 12.10

WRITING.TITLE: Which linux distro should I use? (new post w/ new information)
WRITING.TEXT: I've already tried a few including debian 7 (kinda laggy), Linux Mint 8 (too old). I also have a broadcom internet controller thing so I can't connect unless im wired (I want an OS which doesn't have that issue or can be a very easy fix) im completely new to linux and some of it is still very confusing to me. Specs: inspiron 6400 Intel Core Solo (or Duo???) 1.66ghz 512 MB Ram I basically want something with a very clean and newish looking GUI and something that will make this computer run super fast. I also want something very easy, something which doesn't require me to use terminal very often to get to things.

WRITING.TITLE: [Troubleshooting] Computer keeps freezing!
WRITING.TEXT: Recently I have been downloading and burning a bunch of 700mb linux versions. Just 5 hours ago my computer begun its freezing and does so like 5-10 minutes after i restart it. If I don't restart it, it restarts by itself. When it turns back on, it just stays at this Black Screen (much like how the bootloader screen looks) although there is just one ' | ' blinking cursor thing on the 3rd or 4th line down. Could this perhaps be an issue with my hard drive(s)? 64gb SSD (as my OS drive) 1TB HDD Other specs: i5-3570k Gigabyte Z77x-UD3H G.Skill Ares 8gb 1866mhz Please help me r/buildapc!

WRITING.TITLE: [Troubleshooting] CPU temps too high
WRITING.TEXT: Today I put my computer in a new case and added a new cooler (Xigmatek Dark Knight Night Hawk Edition). I cleaned off CPU of old thermal compound and a line of new and then put on the cooler. I am 80% sure I put on the cooler correctly as the directions SUCK. My temps @ 4.1ghz overclock and 22 degrees celcius room temp: 30 degrees ceclius idle 70 degrees on intelburntest 'very high' test once I overclock to 4.5ghz however, even on the standard intelburntest my temps go up to 100 degrees celcius and I have to stop the test FAST. My old stock cooler was better than this... can somebody help?
